2 weeks ago I was going to kill myself. I‚Äôm so glad I didn‚Äôt!       I hope that whoever is reading this will take my message to heart. My suicidal thoughts were  getting so bad, and my anxiety was even worse. I had nothing left to live for, I made many posts in this sub about how I felt. I was self harming myself practically every day. Then I decided I was done, and I had made a plan to do it. After all, we all die in the end anyways right? But once I had tied the rope, I just couldn‚Äôt bring myself to do it.           A few days go by, and for some reason I decide to workout. I hadn‚Äôt done anything that was very physically intensive in months. I ran 2 miles and did the hardest workout I had ever done. Idk what happened that day, but something in me had changed after that, it was like the clouds around my brain parted for a moment and I saw the light, and I wanted to see all of it.                       I started a self betterment routine: everyday I would work out, mediate, and write in my journal. I started to feel amazing. My anxiety was going away, and I felt better about myself. I was happy. Then one day, late at night, I was watching funny videos and this one song played, and I tried to find it because it was a good song. The song was ‚ÄúOnce In A Lifetime‚Äù by Talking Heads.               The song is basically just an existential crisis in song form, and I started to have one. But then I realized something. Depression has made me feel like that there is no purpose to life, and that nothing will ever get better. And I realized that the depression was right, there is no purpose, and in the end we all die; but it‚Äôs not about the destination, it‚Äôs about the journey.              Every second, we are all living life, experiencing it. And we all know it sucks, and people always say, ‚Äúoh it gets better,‚Äù but we all know it doesn‚Äôt. It doesn‚Äôt just get better, you make it better. It‚Äôs never to late to make a change, my change was my routine, and it opened my eyes to what life really is. Life is just this winding road, but we all choose which ways to turn. There‚Äôs no point in driving it, but if you keep going you can find amazing things. You can do anything, but you‚Äôll never know what happens. And I guess that‚Äôs the just the beauty of life. You just have to make the decision to put your foot on the gas pedal and go. Once you do, you can go anywhere, or see anything. Life is an adventure, and it‚Äôs YOUR adventure. So go and enjoy it, you only have one.

Actively Suicidal Despite All Treatments I've had every single treatment under the sun.  I'm on SSRIs and two mood stabilizers. I've done CBT, DBT and traditional talk therapy. I don't drink or use anymore. I've got all the 'skills' and frameworks.   None of it helps.   I'm still suicidal every couple of days. I'm still making plans and figuring out my means. I'm still trying to figure out how to get my hands on a firearm, and if I can't do that, a noose or enough gasoline for self-immolation.      The sad truth is that when the cause of the pain is external (other people and their abusive or evil behavior) rather than internal (self-loathing), no amount of therapy is going to help. When your life is constantly under threat, when every day you are getting attacked or threatened with violence, sooner or later you just break.

I've been crying hysterically every day for the past few days. I haven't been able to make it thru my shifts at work and I think it might lead me to losing my job, which would suck not because I don't have financial support but because I have a difficult time holding down jobs in general and it makes finding a job difficult. I also live in a city so I was thinking of jumping off a tall building but I don't wanna survive it, and I don't doubt that the people in said building of choice would immediately know what's up. Then there's OD, I have lithium clomipramine and abilify and I am trying to get trazodone for sleep, maybe I could just see what happens? But the one I think I'll end up going with is thru my car. I have a tiny car so I'm wondering if I could just ram it into concrete and die.  I've been writing a note when I can muster up the energy, basically just thanking everyone who's helped and who I love and addressing the issues which lead up to my death.  I just don't want anyone to think I wouldn't do it. I'm in so much pain. It feels like the pain only matters when people are worried about me, when people care. I'm so beyond suffering. I just wanna go.

Having no escape So before anyone says, no, I simply don't have any options. I live with a mom who has repeatedly sexually, physically, and verbally abused me both as a young boy and a verbally abuses me as an adult daily, i've been molested by two men, would get screamed at by my grandma and cousin and abused by teachers and students.  I was talking on the phone to my therapist about it and she felt baffled because I don't actually have options, I can't file for disability and the money would get stolen from me anyways, I can't go homeless, I can't rely on other family members, I have no friends, there are no programs that would accept me because i'm 19, so i'm too old for youth stuff unfortunately, i'm not in school, don't have a license, ID, my birth certificate. I'm a gay guy so the only thing I can think of is going into survival sex work since I can't get a job because of how cripplingly disabled I am by my mental health issues.  With all this being said I think it's time to end it, some people don't get the luck of the draw which I accept. I just want all this to calm down and my suffering to be non-existent, the only feasible way that seems to be the only inevitable route is dying. The only choice however is how long I wanna let myself live, if I wanna stay alive for a couple days then just end it or perhaps simply end it now, I already know if I take enough of my pills i'll go into cardiac arrest and then die, or simply have a swift heart attack and also die. I just wish life wasn't as unfair to people as it has been to me.

Journal 1 So many things I want to say but my mind is a ducking mess. Once again I have to sort through my thoughts just to find the words. So I can let go of this burden. Ive had thoughts once again after a few weeks and ik there's no need to freak out but only move forward. Thing is this idea of mine is too good. I'm too smart and too dumb at the same time. I flip flop between someone in love with live to well this confused gentleman unable to speak his mind. I'm afraid one day I just might throw the towel. Unlikely knowing myself but still frightening.  A living nightmare brought on by my fear of honestly life. It is something beautiful but sometimes it gets you to points where it seems there is no escape. Then you have to find a way out fast before it hits you again. It's tiring. Sometimes you don't even know you been hit and can't even think  of a way out. Just not fair but I guess. That's the way it is. The game is a game. One I hope I see until that bittersweet end.

It might be deep into a desert, or far into a forest, or up to the top of a mountain. Just somewhere far away from all other people, away from lights and sounds and ‚Äúthe world.‚Äù I roll to a stop at some point, I don‚Äôt even really notice that I‚Äôve done it but I‚Äôm just there alone wherever I‚Äôve gone. The windows are rolled down and I can hear the quietness all around. I just sit and escape into that subtle nothing for awhile. And as the sun goes below the horizon just before it gets too dark, I put on a specific playlist I‚Äôve made (I have it and listen to it a lot when I fantasize). I put a needle in my arm and give myself enough opiate to never wake up and I drift away right there and then. Not because I‚Äôm hurt, or sad, or angry.  Just because I want to.

- Dear God,  I love writing letters and I feel if as I'm talking to someone. It makes it easier. I often imagine myself talking about my thoughts and feelings with people that surround me. This time I'm feeling pretty unwell, so I think it deserves a letter.  It doesn't. I just won't calm down otherwise.  I'm so tired of my own brain. I'd be fine if I could just be in pain, but it's harmful to people around me. That's the worst thing.  I'm trying my best to not cry, but I'm incapable of doing so. You see, when I'm sad or in distress my heart hurts. That happens so often. And crying helps.  Your heart can only whisper, so maybe it's trying to let out it's own pain through me. Perhaps it's crying for help, for comfort.  It's so comforting to talk to you. It's so comforting to just be around you, but I can't right now. I'm just in too much stress. I even chopped off my hair, which feels terrible. I don't know why I did it.  You said we'd never meet up. We have a chance and it's a really high chance. Do you want to hear something truly funny?  Yes, you are so right! We aren't going to be together because of me. Because I don't want to.  I absolutely love you and deep down I do want to be together, but I'm just too unstable. If people know how I'm feeling through text, what do you think they'll do when they'll see me in real life. What will you do?  And I'm not even talking about how I look. I look so terrible. My body is fine, but the face. I'm not a pretty one for sure. I'll gladly be confident in front of others, but not you.  I really wish my brain changed. Or I died.

I'm alone I'm 21.  I only have a few friends, and I never get to see them.  I've never had an actual loving relationship, or sex.  The closest thing I ever had to a relationship ended horribly and has scared me off from trying, I think.  I think it's a subconscious thing.  I had a lot more friends when I was younger, and girls seemed more interested in me too.  Now, all I do is go to school, work, hate my life, and then come home to nobody and nothing.  I want to feel what love is actually like again but I can't really even make friends with people.  I haven't made more than a friend or two in college, and I'm graduating in a few months. There's a girl in my class that I'm interested in, and it feels like she's my last chance.  If I can't get a girlfriend in college, why should I expect to get one outside of college?  This is the easiest it's going to be, and I've failed.  She seems like she's interested in me sometimes, but then other times I feel like she couldn't care less.  I can't figure out her personality.  She seems kind of shy, I guess.  I can make her laugh pretty easily and sometimes she'll just randomly turn and look at me and smile.  Other times, like today, she kinda just brushes me off a bit.  Maybe she's playing with me, idk.  When class is over we just walk to our cars together.  We don't talk on the way there, only in class and through text sometimes.  She gets in her car, waves goodbye to me, and then I get in my car and leave.  Maybe I should grow the balls to say something, but what the fuck am I gonna say?  I used to enjoy being the bad guy, but not anymore.  I just want friends and someone to keep me company.  Someone to get me out of the house and do shit with.  I want someone to love, but at the same time, I feel like I'd never be able to keep anyone.  Maybe that's why I never make a move.  How am I going to keep her happy?  I have no experience and don't do/like anything that normal couples would like.  My humor is dark and most people don't like it.  I'm an introvert so that doesn't help either.  I've been trying to be positive, happy, and smiley around this girl, but even today some other girl in the class pointed out how I'm always making jokes about killing myself.  Really nice of her. We all sit next to each other.  The girl I'm into then seemed to pull back a bit.  I don't even have to dig my grave anymore.  Other people have me figured out and they'll do it for me.

And then age 16 it got really bad to the point were it became part of my personality. "You can just suicide whenever you want, life sucks anyways". I show up, they want to have me wear some kind of patches that detect drugs over the course of a year. They're expensive, and I can't afford them. I only took it once. If COVID-19 hadn't happened, I wouldn't have needed the medication.  I have been not taking anything for anxiety and have just lived with them several times a day. My family pushes me closer to ending it all every single day. What do I do? Hey. This feels like the 100th time I've posted on this subreddit, so I apologise for that.   My dad makes me feel like a burden. Like I'd be better off dead. Everything I do is just wrong in his eyes -- I'm never good enough, I'm not normal, I'm ruining everything. Today I actually got my ass out of bed and met up with some old friends who I haven't seen in a while, and I thought maybe he'd be proud of me for going out but apparently not. When I got home I walked into the living room where he was sitting, and I was on my phone because my friends and I took the train and I wanted to make sure they got home okay. He said that that was disrespectful because I didn't say 'hello' right away. Said he was slaving away at work for nothing and I was a little brat. The insults are a recurring theme. I feel worthless.   It's not even just my dad. My mum is constantly snapping at my sister and I about anything and everything and it makes me feel like I can't do anything right. When I say 'anything and everything', I don't mean chores or school or something I'd understand her complaining about, I mean she will literally bite my head off if I ask to make MYSELF food. If I don't ask, I'll still be in trouble. She and my dad both withhold food from me as a punishment, which is not doing wonders for my already poor appetite. I suppose I can't really blame my mum at all though -- my dad's horrid to her. He blames her for the autoimmune disease that's killing her. The hereditary autoimmune disease.   My little sister is the only person in my family who I feel like I have some vague connection with, and even that is such a faint feeling. I don't feel any love towards my parents and it makes me sick. I feel like I'm living with strangers, for the most part, even though they're both usually home. I wish they weren't. I wish one of them would hit me or injure me, because then at least I'd feel valid for hating them.   They just make me feel useless. Y'know? If I ruin everything, I'd be better off just not being here. I don't think they really like me much. Every jab and insult just pushes me closer and closer to early grave, and I don't know what to do anymore. I've already written so many suicide notes to the people I care about. My parents won't get one -- I wouldn't know what to say. I get so envious of my friends who have close relationships with their parents because it's just not something I've ever felt like I have, as much as my parents would insist otherwise. I saw a little kid run up to her dad with a grin on her face the other week and broke a little bit inside.  I don't know. Part of me thinks they'd be better if I was gone, and I think that part of me is probably right. Life keeps throwing all these obstacles at me. My cat got sick (again) and we think he's ingested something poisonous because he was foaming at the mouth. As pathetic as it sounds, my cat's always seemed to understand. I know he's a fucking cat, he doesn't really understand, but whenever I've been upset he's followed me around the house, whenever I've been about to cut my wrists, he's rubbed himself against my arms and stopped me. And now even he might go away -- but that's nothing to do with the post, I'm sorry.   I'm just sick of being treated like I'm nothing and want to kill myself every time I so much as think about my parents. I have to get out of this situation one way or another. What do I do?

I cannot stand the "I know things are hard now, but chin up, things will get better !" sentiment. For fuck's sake. Things just don't "get better", life circumstances don't just change. You have to make them, and if you can't you're fucked. Lots of people are fucked, with their back against a wall and no way out of dire situations. Either you can cope and use the tools available to change your life, or you can't. If you can't change things, you can choose to suffer or give up. A lot of people who suffer choose to suffer because they have faith that if they are patient and good the universe will reward them. The universe rewards no one, it's an indifferent system. People are only willing to suffer and sacrifice everyday if they meaningfully believe it would lead to a fulfilling, happy outcome. Once it becomes clear that this will not be the case, people become either give up or become delusional.

and i thought i was numb a year ago... i've been depressed for years now, but what really made it terrible was the numbness. i can't feel my own feelings anymore, at all. i can't ever get lost in my emotions or drown myself in sorrow. that's how it's been for a year or two. but now it's worse. recently i developed anxiety on top of the depression. i know exactly why i developed it, but i'm not going over that. just know that my life is an absolute mess. it didn't even happen over time, it was more like a switch i couldn't turn off. and now i'm just numb. truly. all my coping mechanisms for depression were rendered useless by anxiety. i haven't felt true relaxation or comfort in months now. i'm basically just a paranoid anxious mess. and now i'm number than ever. at least a year ago i could feel emotions, even if i couldn't truly get carried away by them. at least i could *feel* the suicidal thoughts. now i hardly ever wanna kill myself, but i don't even feel better. just freaked out. i wish i actively wanted to kill myself all the time like i used to. at least it made sense. at least i had *some* direction. at least i was a fucking person back then. my head is a bunch of clouds and i feel like i can't grasp onto anything. i just wanna go back. i wanna feel sad again. i wanna feel something. i can't even get depressed over other people's stories here. they hardly even relate to me anymore. everything is just, blank. who the fuck am i. am i gonna become a sociopath? at this point i'm worried about that. especially with some of the things i've done lately. even my mom seems to be losing her faith in me. i don't even know where i screwed up i just wanna go back. i wanna cry i haven't cried in like 2 years help. i just wanna feel *something*. please!

Is therapy worth it/How to find a therapist? Hi. I'm feeling a little nervous about posting here as I don't want anyone in my real life to find out but I thought this would be a good resource for me. If this post shouldn't go here let me know and I'll take it down.   I'm a first time mom to a 9 month old boy. I've had issues with depression and anxiety since middle school but I've always been able to manage it ok. A few years ago I started taking birth control pills to regulate my hormones which really helped my mental health a lot, so when I got married I just stayed on the pill for preventing pregnancy as well. It clearly didn't work for me, as I now have a 9 month old baby. Since giving birth I've struggled with PPD and PPA, and I needed to start taking some form of birth control again to prevent another pregnancy, but the pill messes with breastfeeding and failed last time so I couldn't do that and got the arm implant instead. I don't know if my current issues have to do with the new implant or just PPD/PPA or just because I haven't been able to take the pill anymore or what, but it's getting bad.   My mental health has declined so much in the last 9 months I feel like I'm not even the same person. It's getting constantly worse and worse every day to the point where I have saved and hidden the bottle of oxycontin they gave me after giving birth (they gave it to me due to complications I won't go into rn), in case I want to take them all at once and end it. I've taken them out of the bottle and just held them in my hand a few times, but I was too weak to go through with it. I know I have enough of them to kill me. I know my husband and son would be better off without me. My son is so young, he wouldn't remember me so he wouldn't truly feel the loss later in life. My husband is young (we're early 20s) and a wonderful man so he could easily find someone else, someone better. I'm toxic and treat him badly. I know he walks on eggshells, the smallest thing can set me off and I have these extreme mood swings, I feel like a crazy person but I can't stop. I completely break down all the time for literally any reason or sometimes no reason. I hate myself. I'm angry and frustrated constantly but I can't show it to my son, I have to make myself smile and play with him and meet his emotional needs, so then I have no energy left for my husband. I'm completely emotionally drained. At the end of every day at I just lay in bed exhausted but unable to sleep, wishing I was dead. I don't want to feel like this anymore, I don't want to feel anything. When I think about death it feels like peace, it gives me comfort. I just want to lay down and sleep and never wake up.   My husband has tried so hard to support me, he took over most of the household chores and is an equal parent when we're both home. I told him I was really struggling and even having some suicidal thoughts but I downplayed it. He begs me to see a therapist but he's scared to push me on it. He tells me all the time he appreciates me, and that he and my son need me. It just makes me feel worse. I've treated my husband so badly and he still is so gentle and caring. He deserves so much better and he'll never leave me and I can't leave him, I cant do this without him, so I should just make the choice for him and he'll be forced to move on and find someone better. He wants me to see a therapist so bad, he's scared and I hate seeing him like this i wish I just hadn't told him. I just can't do this I can't call anyone I can't ask for help I don't want to sit in a room and have someone tell me how shitty I am, I know how shitty I am and I don't need a therapist to tell me about it. what are they going to tell me that I don't already know? How do you even go about finding a therapist? I asked my doctor a couple years ago and she said I have to look into all the therapists in my area and find one that takes my insurance. That feels like an insurmountable hill. Not to mention that even if I find one I might not click with them and I've heard you have to meet several therapists before you find the right one for you I just would rather end it and have this all be over. I don't know what to say to my husband. I have to take my son in for his 9 month checkup in 6 days and they're going to make me fill out that fucking mental health form and I don't know what to do. I dont want to lie, I HATE lying with every fiber of my being, but if I fill it out accurately it'll set off the red flags and they'll have to ask me a bunch of questions and what if they decide I'm not fit to parent because I might kill myselfand  what if they take my son away? What if they call CPS and they try to take him away from me? I would rather die than lose my son. I don't know what to do and I know rhis post is too long and I'm so sorry about that I just don't have anyone to talk to and I don't know what to do and I feel like killing myself is the only option that makes sense.
goodbye i cant do it anymore. no one cares about my story. good night

I really just want to die I‚Äôve felt this way since I was 14, I‚Äôm 18 now. I had toxic friends who told me I couldn‚Äôt be depressed because my life is too good and it wasn‚Äôt possible, they berated me when I started isolating myself, telling me they were scared of me and that I was being a bitch. These people had been my friends for 3 years, I didn‚Äôt have anyone else because I was introverted and shy so I thought I had to stay with them or I‚Äôd have no one. My dad has always been emotionally manipulative and mentally abusive, I was terrified of being left on my own with him until age 12, he made me feel like I wasn‚Äôt worth anything unless I was good at school, which I wasn‚Äôt. I barely passed my GCSEs, I dropped out of A levels when we (the uk) went into the first lockdown because my head of sixth form told me I was just going to fail anyways. I‚Äôve had a string of toxic relationships, been sexually abused a few times. I made really good friendships in the last year but in a matter of weeks I lost all of them and now they all hate me (it was my fault, I made a mistake and I fucked up, I deserved it). I feel so alone and so fucking numb, most days I can‚Äôt get out of bed. I used to get so passionate about things, I used to love so so strongly, but now the only thing I really feel is despair. It‚Äôs like death has a rope tied around me and it‚Äôs slowly dragging me away from everything. I wouldn‚Äôt even care if it just pulled a bit fucking quicker. I‚Äôm not scared of death at all, I haven‚Äôt been for years; I tried to kill myself back in May, I really thought I was going to die and I wasn‚Äôt scared at all, I was relieved that I would finally be able to rest properly. Since then it‚Äôs just gotten worse and all I can think about is how beautiful it would be just to suddenly cease to exist, to finally be at peace. The only reason I haven‚Äôt is because I feel so selfish leaving my mum on her own, she loves me so much and I love her, I just wish she could understand how much pain I‚Äôm in all the time and how difficult it is just to be alive. Actually fuck that, I‚Äôm not alive, I haven‚Äôt been alive for months, I‚Äôm just existing in a world that didn‚Äôt anticipate me surviving this long. Living isn‚Äôt lying in bed crying your eyes out every night. Living isn‚Äôt smiling to everyone and doing such a good job of convincing them you‚Äôre okay after years of practice. Living isn‚Äôt getting up and going about my day in a trance, feeling so numb it‚Äôs as if I‚Äôm watching someone else live my life for me while I crouch in the corner of my mind, shivering and sobbing. The worst part is that I don‚Äôt want to live. I don‚Äôt want to be happy because it makes it so much worse when you go back down again, I don‚Äôt want to be happy because that means having people around and all I‚Äôll do is hurt them. I just wish there was a way to stop existing and make everyone forget I ever existed in the first place. I don‚Äôt want people to mourn for me because I want to die to stop hurting them. I wish people could see how much pain I‚Äôm in and how exhausted I am so that maybe they could understand even slightly why I felt I had to do it. I wish people could just be happy that I‚Äôd be at peace for the first time in so long. I just really really want to die.

‚ÄúIf you aren‚Äôt satisfied with how you are living life then change it.‚Äù But I don‚Äôt have the motivation or drive to change it and I see myself suffering no matter what happens but I can easily kill myself and be over with this as it seems like the better option. Is my suicide justified then? Why does the majority of people think that most suicides are not justified. They can justify a person kill themselves if they are suffering with immense physical pain that isn‚Äôt going to go away considering how many options they have tried to reduce the suffering but to no avail. But when a person kills themselves if they are suffering with immense emotional pain that isn‚Äôt going to go away considering how many options they have tried to reduce the suffering but to no avail, then people say the suicide isn‚Äôt justified.  Look, I‚Äôm only 20. But I‚Äôve been depressed since I was 10. I‚Äôm always complaining about how shit my life is. Sometimes I will try and change it for the better but I simply do not have the motivation and drive to make it consistent. The depression, dysthymia to be exact, always comes back and it comes back hard when I try and better myself. I am simply not enjoying life. I don‚Äôt see a life where I do enjoy it. People tell me not kill myself because I‚Äôm so young, there‚Äôs still a lot to do in life, and that it‚Äôs not worth it.  For the past few months I have been heavily debating on whether or not I kill myself. I look at the pros and cons and the pros seem to outweigh the cons. I try to stay alive a little longer just to see if things change for the good but so far there hasn‚Äôt been anything in life that does keep me going. I‚Äôm so stressed out or whether or not to die. I don‚Äôt necessarily want to die, I only want to end my suffering because I can‚Äôt find a solution other than suicide. It looks like I have to do it.

Emotional spiraling I can sense Them.   Feelings.   For you might see Them as a gem,    but They jumble all my meanings.      I loathe Them.    Spiders.   With Their empty eyes, my soul condemn,    best at creeping upon us - skilled hiders.      Might be deeply terrified,    I just don't see a treasure full of insects to be worth the try.   Maybe your hazard seems justified,    but I'm just tired of getting attached only to get in bed and cry.      Every time I think of an infatuation,   I can feel spiders crawling from my esophagus down my tummy,   try to bend and wreck the pure and precious into a new creation,    devour the butterflies just because they looked so yummy.      Now that the fragile can no longer fly and feel,    the jewels - hidden under webs and corpses,    everything just feels surreal,    maybe it's just my fault cuz all I do is obsess.     Do you get it?    I yearn to stop.   I keep getting bit.    Every emotion is a hit.      I'm so down and beaten up.    I feel the venom in my veins.    I think I can pour my thoughts into a cup,    but no one's gonna want to drink my brains.     The taste, I imagine, is gonna be so bitter,    no particular smell,    just the essence of a quitter.   I think the only place I belong to is hell.      I just feel out of control.    I thought I hit rock bottom but alas,    I kept digging down that damned hole,    until I feel disconnected from my mass.      There's no progression ever.    I'm just stuck here.    Rotting in the pit forever,    white noise is all I hear.

My friend committed suicide two weeks ago. Two weeks ago I lost one of my closest friends to suicide. Usually I'm a guy who takes life in a very ordered manner: one hurdle over the next. I don't believe in wallowing in self pity or oversharing on the internet, but sheesh guys this is hard. People go on and on about how you shouldn't feel guilty about not being there, but the truth is that I can't feel anything else. I really do wish that I was in the same room to tell him "NO!". I wish I was there to hug him a last time. I wonder a lot if he thought about me ... was I not enough to make him stay?  I've never quite cried this much in my life and my entire world is collapsing into this burning hell on Earth. Everyday when I get up I can't send a stupid snap, share an unfunny history meme, or wonder about the future loudly. Who am I going to go to swim meets with? Who am I going to talk to to? All of a sudden, life is getting very real. Throughout this senior year, I've maintained a really good GPA and kept up with absolutely everything even through quarantine but honestly, I can't do this anymore. It's hurting me to think that life is going to move on.  I attended his funeral a week ago and listening to the pastor was disgusting. He was saying things like "he chose to leave". I do not believe that my best friend made the active choice to leave - he felt helpless and lonely - those are not the same thing. I will never believe that one thoughtfully considers the choice of killing themself.  I feel thrown off my path. It sucks to say this, but I'm going to have to prioritize my exams this spring over my mental health or anything else. And also, to hell with society about the stigma around mental health. You live in hell and make others walk through hell as well when you say us guys can't speak about our emotions. To hell with this rotten education system that requires 17 and 18 year olds to make choices about their 40 year-old selves.  I'm going to try to end by saying that it's going to kill me just the same when I have to graduate without him, listen to our favourite songs without him or get married and not have him be my best man. I'm getting ripped apart piece-by-piece everyday but I'm going to have to move forward with this pain. I need to hope that it hurts less in the future. I just need to get though my IB exams. I just need to make it to May.  I hope that if you've ever "*considered*" commiting suicide, you're being played by your own brain. Please do your loved ones a favour and go goddamn write, talk, scream your problems. Please. It hurts everyone. It is not worth it.

How does the afterlife affect your suicidal thoughts? I have suffered from sporadic suicidal thoughts and depression for about a year now. I'm a 22 y/o male living in a Scandinavian country. I don't belong to any particular religion. But I'm very spiritual. And I know for a fact (no matter how much one might try to convince me on the contrary) that if I should die ‚Äì there IS a afterlife. Nothing can change this truth of mine. I've been a firm believer in the hereafter and the spiritual nature of the human soul long before I ever knew was depression or suicidal idiation was.  Knowing life will continue, I would actually rather want to exit this life and move on the next one. But I know I shouldn't. And I also know it will never happen because I could never inflict this much emotional trauma on my poor unsuspecting and kind parents ‚Äì as well as other people in my life.  But still, I want to go back to "God" (or your understanding of the source) and have nothing more to do with this world of darkness, challenges and despair. What should I do? Can anybody relate?  Also, I am afraid I will become a sinner of sorts or a bad person later on in life (even though I'm actually very compassionate) and that scares the crap out of my because I fear I might suffer in the next life. I'm not a Christian though. And when I say "suffer in the next life" I'm not talking about Heaven or Hell. Much less burn in eternal flames. I'm just concerned I won't be rewarded well for my acts and choices in this life if I continue living it and have the opportunity to make choices ‚Äì so I might as well just kill myself right away and go back to the place of love and light from whence I came.  I miss that place soooo much.... and I'm starting to cry now! Oh, I need help!!!

Suicide Survivor: My two cents First of all, I lost almost everyone I loved the most to untimely deaths in recent history. That includes the love of my life who died at 33, my father, several friends and family. I have attempted suicide so many times with full intention to carry it out and I never thought I‚Äôd say I‚Äôm grateful I‚Äôm alive.  I knew that covid would negatively affect people with depression, anxiety and suicidal ideations. I‚Äôve lost loved ones to suicide before, and last April was no exception.   I‚Äôve gone to funeral after funeral after funeral. Life doesn‚Äôt promise us anything except that one day it will be over, so until then why not stick it out?  I want to share a couple things that I hope will help some of you out there. My wish is that whoever is reading this will shed light.   ‚Ä¢ We tend to want to disappear in order to be found. We also can want to disappear from existence because we are tired and the burden gets beyond heavy. You‚Äôre more resilient than you think. There‚Äôs always someone out there you may not have met yet who has an open heart and hand to be there for you. Your life and existence is an unique as a fingerprint. It‚Äôs one thing to relate but be careful when you compare. Life isn‚Äôt a Competition as much as a lot of people make it out to be. Sometimes a lot of want to see if ‚Äúanyone cares‚Äù to find us....I‚Äôm telling you people do. Start with me because I do care about you...and I mean it.  ‚Ä¢ Why was I born? To make a difference for yourself and you have the power even in the smallest of ways to make a difference. I‚Äôve asked myself why the hell I had to be born. ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt my mom abort me?‚Äù Crap like that. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt ask to be born.‚Äù Well, I‚Äôm here. I was given life for ME, and at the end of the day you were given life to allow yourself to enjoy. You can be there for people you care about, but you have to take time to look into what it really means to love yourself. Youtube has a lot of videos on self love. I know it seems like a dumb corny idea, but it‚Äôs worth giving yourself a fighting chance. You were born to go on a quest to experience more than just the lame and depressing situations we can feel stuck in. Reach out.   ‚Ä¢ The simple things in life can be more rewarding than you think. Mindfulness helps a ton. It may seem trivial, but as human beings the mind tends to be geared toward: instant gratification, quick fix, NEXT  Take time to actually taste the food and drink. Take time to focus on your body when you take deep breaths to relax. Meditation is underrated.  ‚Ä¢ Loneliness and longing for connection is normal. Amid this uncertain time, there are several platforms on cool new apps to meet new people. It may seem lame but you never know who you‚Äôre going to meet and connect with. You might actually enjoy yourself.   ‚Ä¢ We tend to have habits of thinking and cycles we revisit. The hardest part of breaking any habit is the beginning. Then it becomes easier and more rewarding, because the fruits of labor are.   ‚Ä¢ Allow yourself to be treated as if you were treating someone you love the most. We tend to negative self talk quite often and I‚Äôm telling you to cut that out immediately. We all have to keep ourselves in check but put down the bat. If you like to do art or sing because you like it even though you may feel like you‚Äôre not ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù, do it! Anyone can make art, and it‚Äôs so much healthier for the brain than people think. Don‚Äôt limit yourself. Don‚Äôt sell yourself short.   ‚Ä¢ Bad memories are part of life unfortunately, but there‚Äôs got to be at least one okay memory you have right? If you‚Äôre saying ‚Äúno‚Äù you‚Äôre lying to yourself. It‚Äôs okay, right now you feel like crap and it feels like everything absolutely 100% sucks....but give it a little time....you‚Äôll think of a good memory.....and perhaps (probably) there will be a good time in your future that you wouldn‚Äôt have imagined.  That‚Äôs all I have for now. Reading a lot of your entries from less than a half a day ago, I am praying more than anything you all hang on, and I‚Äôm here for anyone.

Does it actually get better? Been fighting so hard for so long.  So far I've came out the other side of anorexia, just keeping my head, but everything still hurts.  No, it hurts more now I'm not hiding from the pain by obsessively counting calories and trying to shrink.  It's meant to be BETTER on the other side.  I'M meant to feel better.  But I just feel worse.  Emotionally tired. Drained.  To make matters worse, the one I could depend on isn't available.  After over 20yrs, that person is distant.  They were one of my last hopes.  Even that's gone.  Does. It. Ever. Get. Better. Than. This?  The suicidal thoughts came back on Saturday night.  Again yesterday.  And today.  Drove off yesterday and sat in the middle of nowhere hoping I'd die in the snow from hypothermia but chickened out.  Guess I'm either a coward or hate myself so much I can't end everything.  I guess I'm so worthless and repulsive that no one will even look at this.  But at least it means no one will stop me from trying to kill myself properly next time.

Why i want to die. Before I talk about my experiences as a child, I would like to disclaim that i come from a very African and extremely religious background.  My parents are both Nigerian immigrants, so they didn't exactly have a Western upbringing. I am only 15(as of me writing this) and i have a very complex relationship with my parents.   To cut the long story short, I am the black sheep of my family. I am  perceived as the troublemaker and i am first one to be accused of something when something goes wrong.(e.g, if something gets broken) My parents think i am bad influence on my younger brother and i  should follow in the example  of my older brother.(But i have to act like the oldest brother anyway because my brother is very emotionally immature and may been on the spectrum) And i am not going lie; i can be very rebellious. My parents find  me to be the most outspoken out of my brothers and i question lot of things; including religion.(I will get onto that later)   The person i have the most issues within the family is my mother. My dad wasn't home that often due to his long business trips, so most of my early childhood was spent with only my mum and my 2 brothers. My mum had a huge temper and would get riled up over the most trivial things. She was also extremly determined for us to do well in school, so she was extremely hard on us. Without my father around to ease her temper, she fully embraced a "spare the rod, spare the child mentality".  She was the hardest on me especially, since i was somewhat mischievous when i was younger but some of the punishments she gave me still tramuatize me till this day.  Imagine being beaten for having bad handwriting instead being helped. Imagine being teased and called names by your mother when you wet the bed.("The Pee Master")  Imagine  being told to stay and die while choking on a Dorito chip by your own mother at 9 years old. Imagine being 7 or 8 years old and grabbed , pulled upside down and put my head near the toliet hole just for not understanding a maths homework and yelled at.(" Do it properly! Do It Properly!) Imagine being chased out of your piano lesson because you lied about losing your music theory book, manipulated to come back to her (because i was smaller and faster than her, i was only 9); then dragged back into the building and thrown onto the stairs. Punched in the face twice, giving you a small bruise under the eye and bitten on the leg to stop you from escaping. The other students heard my screams. Imagine being forced by your father to say I'm a Christian (even though im athiest) because im afraid that this 55 year old man is going to hit my 13 year old face; your mum then forcing you to read Bible verses. Imagine barely escaping being stabbed and robbed by gang affiliates and your own mother instead of comforting you; said it was your fault , didn't care you got killed and said you were a bad influence on your younger brother. And then later on, "apologising" by saying, "I have to be hard on you". Thanks a lot mum, you gave the best gifts a child could ever  have; mental scars and anger issues.  And that's only the half of it. I am also severely bullied at school but that's a different story.   Now i am not ignoring the fact that my mother is human too and she has issues of her own. Her own mother died when she was 9 and her dad had 5 wives.(It was 60s/70s Nigeria, it was a different time) She often said that she had to grow up fast and look after her other siblings. Her younger brother(my uncle) got pancreatic cancer and slowly died in our house.  But im not going to deny the fact that she especially, hurt me deeply. Sometimes at the back of my mind, i ponder at the idea that it was my fault why she treated me that way. Maybe i pestered her on the wrong day, or i behaved too badly and needed that discipline.  Was it abuse?

sister did once when my mother did not to take us out for a promised dinner night out and they started arguing and my mother told my sister to just hit her with a belt so that‚Äôs what happened. my sister apologized afterwards and they never brought it up again, unlike the many times my mother brought up my past arguments saying how selfish and ungrateful i was.   i was also bullied during middle school for my looks, being half chinese and a generally just being a socially-awkward kid ( due to my family background). i don‚Äôt remember exactly when i started self-harming amidst my school and family troubles, but i can truly say that however an unhealthy coping mechanism it was, it helped me survive a lot of things. i‚Äôm mostly clean for now but still have occasional relapses, and while i do carry no remorseful thoughts towards my mother nor my middle school bullies anymore, but i just want them to accept how they have impacted me as a person, and will continue to be so until i interests so i just chose the field because of the money. my parents got separated right when i was entering uni so i now live with my mother. her anger issues have gotten better and she doesn‚Äôt physically hurt me now.   truth be told, i still always feel lost deep inside, like that helpless little girl despite my friends telling me that i‚Äôm pretty, confident, smart, friendly and that i have a bright future ahead. i have been on anxiety/depression meds for almost three years now and they did help, but this constant thought of wanting to die has never left me. i‚Äôm planning to kill myself once i clear all of my family‚Äôs debt and amass enough fortune for all of them to live a comfortable life after i pass.   idk why i‚Äôm typing out all of this now, but it feels nicer to let it all out. sorry for any grammatical mistakes since i‚Äôm not a native speaker. thank you for reading my rant, wish you all a great day.

I'm so¬†sorry this is long and detailed.¬†  She was my work colleague for 2 months before she moved on and¬†I got to know her properly. We were together for almost 3 years and left on really good terms. We left because we knew it was too much work for both of us - I'm Christian and part-Palestinian, she's Jewish and part-Israeli. We were so deep in the relationship but also hesitant. Hesitant because of our family's reaction to our sexuality,¬†religious and ethnic backgrounds. But I went into it because I knew there was a chance for a long term relationship - both of us worked in London and far away from our families who live outside the city.  She's Cambridge educated and one of the brightest and quickest minds in one of the most difficult and prestigious careers you could get into. So, my mind told me I didn't need to check on her all those months - she was definitely doing well after moving on from me and finding someone else.   She placed a missed call yesterday¬†morning¬†and I¬†called back later that night¬†to check why.¬†I was anxious to pick up¬†because her call¬†meant something serious. She told me she called to hear my voice and apologise for telling me we couldn't work out.   I knew something was up so tried¬†to stay as calm as possible. I told her it was lovely to hear from her, asked her¬†where she was, if anyone was with her¬†etc. and she told me she was alone¬†in her flat, she apologised for calling earlier and that she was just dealing with a small overdose. I knew I had to get her medical attention¬†. We finished the call without me telling her I was driving to her flat.  I got to¬†her flat and told her I just wanted to see her, to¬†speak to her. She let me in and we were so quiet. Nobody spoke for about 15 minutes,¬†until I noticed she was getting off the sofa and I just went up to her and held her really tight. I didn't¬†want her to leave, I didn't¬†want her to go out of my sight for a second. I knew I had to be extra careful with my words to get her to come with me to the hospital. We sat talking about everything¬†for a good 4 or so hours and I could tell she was in visible pain. I tried to be as subtle as possible, told her let's go together and check on you, just a quick check to see what's going on but it'll¬†ultimately be your choice whether you want that treatment or not. She told me she wouldn't go, that she just wanted to wait at home for everything to end. We were silent for a while after she said that. I¬†felt¬†like I fucked up with my words because she¬†didn't¬†budge. I left her flat and just sat in the car,¬†I couldn't just sit at home and¬†let it happen. I walked¬†back to her flat a few hours later, called emergency services and begged for her to come, just for a check up and somehow convinced her when they arrived.  I don't¬†know what to do, I¬†could only call those who knew about our relationship (all but one are¬†outside the city), so¬†I have almost no physical¬†support. I've not slept in so long and called in sick for work today. What do I do if she gets upset with me?¬†What can I do to help prevent this being repeated in the future? Please just anything you think helped you or someone you know.¬†

I see no point in continuing this nonsense. I don't see a point in much of anything anymore. Living, "getting better," getting a job, going back to school, talking to people, trying to eat/sleep/take care of my hygiene better, having hobbies, exercising, taking care of my pets. None of it inspires me, excites me, motivates me.  There's no satisfaction to any of it. No reward. Just an empty, hollow relief that dies out when I realize I have to do the thing again. It's not to say I don't get some of it done but, it takes so much strength.  None of these things make anything better. Nothing gets better, or stays there. Everything is constantly decaying. My will to live is at an all time low. There's so much *work* to living, and I'm so uninterested in all of it. The people that I know I love, and know they love me, mean nothing to me. I feel guilt and shame admitting it. Their presence does not outdo the pain.  I really do believe that I genuinely want to die. A life with this brain, with all these damn diagnoses. ADHD, Anxiety, Depression, all the fucking trauma that treating NONE of it has given me. I don't get to choose my brain chemistry. I don't get to choose to be functional, to heal. My surroundings and health don't let me.  I'll ALWAYS have to struggle, with all of it. I don't ever grow. I don't ever change. Nothing that I could control has ever helped. What got me going to school was the threat of literal violence against me if I wouldn't go. What got me to work was the threat that my girlfriend at the time would leave me if I didn't get a job. What made me work was fear. Fear of pain, fear of abandonment.  But those fears have been realized. My suffering continues in spite of my efforts to get better. My pain, my loneliness, my depression, it has all overtaken my strength and suppressed it. I tried so hard, for so long, to make so many people happy. Or at least, satisfy them enough so that they'd stop screaming at me. Nobody has ever been happy by what I had accomplished. They just scream at me and insult me and give up on me. I guess it's better than when I'd get beaten with a belt for having low grades but, ultimately that's all that life is. Punishment for trying.  Go work 80 hours a week and live in a motel because you're paid like shit and everything is so expensive. Go get a degree that will put you in lifelong debt so that you can get a raise of 2 cents compared to your uneducated peers. Go have hobbies so that people can belittle you everyday about them and tell you it's a waste of time. Go to doctors and therapists who tell you constantly that you're everything that's wrong with your life, essentially, and deny you treatment because you aren't useful to society. Take care of your basic survival so you can keep doing this bullshit, stress over every essential thing constantly. And better yet! The world is burning and society is going to collapse in your lifetime.  Why? Why live through that? I'll never have anywhere or anyone who is a truly safe space. I'll never be comforted by anyone's love. Familial, platonic, romantic, anyone. Everyone else is building up their life, moving forward. Leaving me behind. Why would they spend time with me? What do I have to offer? Jack fucking shit.  I'm an unmotivated, grotesquely deformed, waste of bone and flesh on this Earth. I would serve more purpose rotting than I ever could alive. But every single time I've ever tried to hurt myself, not even off myself, but any self harm, I can't do it. I want to SO badly. SO damn badly. I'm just so weak, so stupid and cowardly. I can't.   I don't even know why I wrote all this. It hasn't helped. There are no kind words from strangers or tips & tricks that can outdo the degree to which I am miserable. All I ever really wanted was to been seen, heard, valued. Really truly loved from the depths of someone's soul, unconditionally. So many people in my life have abandoned me. They do one thing, say another. Insulted me for trying, critiqued me for existing, belittled me for my passions. I am nothing. I am absolutely, positively, nothing.

I can't quit contemplating suicide, and the thought of my future only makes it worse. I obviously cannot stop thinking of the future in the immediate present without a good sum of damage being done to, well, my future... so it's self-perpetuating. I can't take that much more. Let's start with modern events. My mother was in the CIA and not only had she given me a supreme love and appreciation for what they do, she has shown me how much they give up to do it -- they give up, on some level, their freedom so that others can have theirs. This damages their sense of self so badly that they can develop mixed depression, anxiety, PTSD and BPD as well as NPD on top of it. Imagine having that as your mother, no matter how understandable the reasoning behind it is. Seeing certain aspects of her job crushed and used politically for either side actually damages a part of my self-identity, as I often used them as a standard for myself to measure up to as I've inherited many of her less beneficial traits **and** acquired PTSD from her (and my school's) treatment of me.  Alone, it's a huge weight to bear -- my past, for better and worse. However, remember how I said I had inherited many of her less beneficial traits? I'm autistic. I have ADHD. I have major depressive disorder, as well as anxiety on top. I also have PTSD. These things *prevent* me from working -- from taking proper instruction, from learning like everyone else, to even handling certain objects because of their texture or how they sound or feel (I would rather be NAKED than have sand in my boots, for example, and I will take my clothing off instead of 'dealing with' the sensations, they're so unbearable.)  I also have an IQ of... I think, 163 as tested when I was around 7. I'm AWARE of all of this. I'm trapped in some weird sack of meat that doesn't cooperate with me. I share a symbiotic relationship with it, and I love it dearly, but it's just so heart-breaking to have so many people expect so much of me because of a number everyone -- supposedly -- assumes is meaningless for good reason. They ignore, for example, the fact I even can wound myself so badly with a single centimeter-deep gash that the floor is covered in blood. It really would have been nice if the people in my past took my advice and just let me get a lethal dose of morphine to put an end to my suffer, but I'm so afraid now that my future is solely me as either a hunter-gatherer -- illegal -- or me as a criminal, the likes of which have died early or hurt so many people because of their cunning. If I am meant to be a sacrifice, can you at least make it quick...? Not a 21-year endeavor...?

I went into crisis and now I'm in the hospital because my mom saw my septum So I pierced my septum a few days ago, and today I forgot to flip it up. My mom saw and went crazy. She was screaming at me. I eventually went into crisis and screamed back, begging her to scall the cops to get me out of there. I threatened suicide, to kill her. I threw a brick at my wall and now there's a hole. She kicked me out and i came back an hour later. She said she was calling the cops so she wouldn't get in trouble for kicking me out. Not because she cared about me, but because she didn't want charges. She forced me to leave, throwing my shit at me. I refused this time, and waited in my room. I just went on my phone and cried. We've had fights but never this big. I went to get my dog for comfort and she just ran away. That was the worst part. I decided to try to kill myself but had nothing. I told my mom I was going to kill myself and she told me to just do it. I sat around then decided to pierce my belly button because I had just gone out to get the jewelry and I really liked the ring. I'd been wanting it for a while and this was my last chance before the cops came. I positioned the needle and just as I was about to push the cops knocked on the door. I was so scared I decided to do it as fast as possible so I wouldn't make things worse. Did it in 30 seconds. Love the piercing but it really hurts now. The cops came in and talked to me, asked what I wanted to do. I said I wanted to go to the psych ward so I could leave the house for short term. They let me pack up. When they came back I showed the new cop my stuffies. Theres another cop who always shows up and she thinks she's on first name basis with me but I hate her. The cops drove me to the hospital and now I'm in the er waiting to be admitted. I my mom doesn't want anything to do with me and I'm here all alone. I want to end it all but there's nothing here. I might do it when I get home.   I feel like a waste of space. There's a bunch of old people in the er. It's so loud and I want to go home. But I have no home. I hate this  I'm too scared to sleep.

Reaching out is so damn hard for me. I'm falling down this hole, once again for the 100th time in the last 13 years.  I have two people to talk to, occasionally three when he desides to have a working phone, but most of the time I isolate myself. It's easier that way, because if I do break, and I'm afraid that I will, the less they lose the less they will hurt. Today my friend saved me in knowingly from writing the fatal note. He didn't know and he never will, he just showed up to take me out for a drive like we've done so many nights. Before he showed up I had been sitting curled up in a ball in my shower so no one could see or hear what's happening to me. It'd better that they don't know just how bad it is, they don't understand that getting help is as hard as it is. "Just talk about it." They say, but when I explain to them the last time I had done that I was told I was just a spoiled little brat. By a professional. Even when I try to talk to my dad about it, he doesn't really listen. My sister doesn't care, all she's worried about is her cosplay. My friend I tell this to doesn't help, the only thing I get from her is "I feel that, geez, damn." I know she cares she simply doesn't know how to deal with my bs. So I guess this is me reaching out for the first time. The thoughts are getting too loud now to ignore, whenever I drive I have the urge to end it all. I go into a store and I immediately panic, whether it's the abuse I suffered at the hands of men, or whatever else is wrong with me. My dad's angry because I'm "not trying hard enough" but I cook and do all the shopping despite wanting nothing more than to cease existence. I don't know if I would kill myself or not, but if a car was speeding towards me I don't think I would move.
There is officially no hope Nothing that can be said or done will help me.

Feeling Guilty About Feelings During Pandemic...? I'm in Ontario, Canada, so currently we aren't under any lockdown or anything that extensive. However, it seems like we are heading in that direction. I have really poorly managed anxiety, we've been playing with my meds for months now. Almost a year ago I had a pretty serious suicide attempt, and it's been a waiting game since then to try and get me back on track due to the lack of access to the appropriate medical services.  Anyways, I feel guilty for becoming suicidal during the pandemic. There's so much else happening everywhere (there's no cases in my town), that I feel bad for even considering killing myself but that guilt is what's driving me to the edge. I feel like it's only a matter of  time before I snap. I live alone and I'm terrified that if they quarantine us I won't be able to see my caseworker or my therapist. I've been seeing someone twice a week most weeks because I can't make it more than a few days without going into extreme distress. It doesn't help that I'm coming out of a manic episode. I'm  terrified of being locked in my apartment alone, and I'm scared that i don't know what's happening. I don't even care about the virus. If I get it, I'm a high risk, so it might be bad. But we don't have any cases here. I'm more worried about the actions of other people. I have severe gastroparesis and I'm just so done with living a this point because I'm in such a horrible flare. I can't eat anything. The things I can eat everyone is emptying the shelves of (panic buying soup and rice...etc).   I  don't know what to do.  Ifeel like I can't go to the hospital to reach out for help and support when I'm in crisis, but I also can't keep doing this. My classes got cancelled and I'm thinking that I will be out a job next week most likely (based on how things are going right now) as well...please help I don't know what to do, I know deep down I want to live and that's why I'm reaching out but right now I'm losing all of my reasons. I've been staying in bed all day everyday and that's usually one of the final signs for me.

Rant I don‚Äôt want to die, I just want to be happy. I would be alright with existing if life wasn‚Äôt so hard. It is hard for no goddamned reason. Chronic pain, anxiety, depression, body dysmorphia, lack of self-confidence, past trauma, struggling with religion, and let‚Äôs not get started on how fucked society and humans can be. All of those things make the world around you feel as though it is constantly crumbling and will never be built back up again. It is hard to find the positivity and light in each day. I want so hard to be positive and have a good mindset, but I am so sure you guys know how hard that can be.  I love my family and my cat so much, they are my reason to be alive. I couldn‚Äôt imagine leaving my cat behind and her not knowing where I went and missing me. I can‚Äôt imagine the thought of my parents wondering where they went wrong and how they would feel living on if I ended it. The guilt I feel from even thinking about suicide is what keeps me alive.  Naturally, I have and (hopefully) always will be too afraid.

How is suicide not radical acceptance? Hear me out...  When a person has a physically terminal illness they go through stages - anger, denial etc until the reach acceptance (or they die during the process)  While we are still in the dark ages when it comes to understanding mental illness it seems there is evidence that some mental heath issues are pathological. We‚Äôve all seen people so far gone in the combined effects of trauma, mental health issues and the distorted thinking that is part of it that we know they will likely kill themselves at some point.   How we can selectively decided to use radical acceptance to deny what seems to be  reality in some cases baffles me.   As this is an anti-suicide forum though please refute me and tell me logically why am I wrong to think this, why we keep telling to stay alive in spite of their inability to find any happiness or usefulness in it.

there's nothing you could say that would make me feel any different and i don't want you to try. i guess i'm just making this post to say that i've  accepted that no matter what my life is like, i won't feel better. no matter how many friends i have, no matter how i look... i'll still be miserable.   people say it gets better, but there's no proof that will truly happen. what does better even look like? i know that as long as i'm in my body, being the person i am, i will not get anywhere close to healing or "better".  i've reached past the point of active suicidal behavior. i'm not in critical danger. i'm just living every day in a fog, hoping i won't wake up as myself or hoping i won't wake up at all. i only feel happy when i'm completely distracted.  i wonder why society doesn't mind if i kill myself slowly. you know, eat shitty foods, waste my life with mindless consumption, numb myself down with unhealthy behaviors until i die of heart disease. but the thought of me wishing for a less painful and quicker way out is abhorrent?   the worst part of all this might be the fact that i know i'm not that awful of a person. from an objective lens, i see some good qualities. i know i have a lot of love in my heart, even if it's hidden a lot of the time. i really care for others. i have a girlfriend who means everything to me. and if i ever make a friend again, i know i will try as hard as i can to show that person nothing but endless compassion. but what does it matter? i could be the most selfless person in the world, and i'd still be in pain. i would still hate who i am. why am i supposed to continue suffering? how come i don't get a say?  i used to have so many hopes and dreams. now i just feel really stuck. and yes, i know my current situation isn't permanent. but the brain i have is. and it will follow me wherever i go. that's why i know nothing can make it better. believe me, i've tried.  thank you reading. i just needed to vent somewhere and i'm glad to have this space.

Do I actually want to be alive?  No.

Bo Burnham's new special really spoke to me I've struggled all year to find a way to write about how the pandemic affected me.  The guilt about the focus on yourself is overpowering, but you can't help it because the timing is laughable. You finally start to recover from a terrible break up, you come home to an empty apartment infested with insects you can't touch without swelling up. You live out of your car for about a month, because you can't bring yourself to publicly own up to the chaos of your life and just ask to couch surf. Your grandmother dies of a disease ravaging your family tree. You quietly wonder how long you are going to have. You go to see her whenever you can afford it, and watch as she withers in front of you. She tells you to respect the doctor with the nice suit, no matter what you overhear him say. Her last words to you are goodbye. You thank her for the suit she bought you that got you into medical school. You are having a fight with your brother on Christmas, just like you do every year. He puts your career at risk. You finally cut him out (again), the world falls apart. They announce that starting next year Step 1 is going Pass/Fail, but not for you. You try to study for your exams, all the libraries and cafes close because of a centennial pandemic. You try to study in your apartment, your brother dies alone in a hot trailer on the other side of the country. You try to get to him, the airports are shut down. You drive across the country with your girlfriend, your car tire explodes just outside of the city while a hurricane comes bearing down. You camp as you drive because all the motels are closed. You avoid cities because they are all rioting. You don't make it before they have to cremate him. You don't get to say goodbye or figure out why. You sit for your board exam. You score well enough to not complain, but literally a point below the widely accepted cutoff for the specialty you want to pursue. You meet with the local Program Director and they make sympathetic noises until they hear the three digit number and scramble to write it down before telling you that they would never train you. You've shadowed there throughout the first two years, and volunteered on squads. Doesn't matter because of this one test. Your new girlfriend takes a job where she can. It isn't close by. You go back South. Your cat has a stroke while you get scored with 3/5s for "lack of dedication" on overnights on OBGYN. Your brother's elderly dog passes away. You come home to an empty apartment. The panic attacks and nightmares come back. You try to learn medicine. You survive, doing just well enough to be perennially ignored, and just poorly enough that you don't see options. They tell you you should read more.  You worry all anyone sees are the times you complain. The moments of anger and frustration as you tread academic water with three bricks around your throat. When people reach out, you don't believe them. After all, where were they for the first year of hell? For the second? Where were they when you tried to ask? But now that it doesn't matter, now that they can write an essay about how good a person they are for supporting their classmate, without sacrificing leadership positions or study time for Step, they want to help? No, the voice says. Screw that.  You should stay inside.   You buy a weapon. You stare at it every time you come home.

For fucks sake I don‚Äôt want to be here I‚Äôm 16, I haven‚Äôt directly asked about my past but split parents at birth and a weekend schedule make it pretty obvious I was an accident,  I fucking can‚Äôt stand it here, I‚Äôve learnt my father is a broken man and to be honest I can‚Äôt blame him, his life is worse than mine by a long shot, but I‚Äôm well on my way to being in his position if I don‚Äôt do something soon  I hate that I can‚Äôt go to the shops alone without wanting to throw up because I‚Äôm afraid of interacting with the cashier and making an idiot of myself and feeling that nauseating eating sensation in my stomach that comes from making an idiot of myself in public. I hate that I lost my girlfriend of 3 fucking years (a lot of time to someone who has only lived 16) because I had to move away and making contact again just wouldn‚Äôt happen. I hate that I can‚Äôt talk to anybody about this because it brings attention to me that I don‚Äôt know how to handle, I hate that I don‚Äôt feel attraction to anybody anymore (though that might be a blessing to be honest), I hate that my friendships are loose enough that I could block everyone I know and nobody would bat an eye, I hate that I can‚Äôt plunge a kitchen knife into my carotid artery and die because I‚Äôm scared of the pain  The thing that pisses me off the most is that I was robbed blind by life. I was doing great until around 11 years old, at that age you start maturity and all that fun stuff and that‚Äôs when kids get reaally nasty. But it‚Äôs ok because your friends are going through it too right? Well not when you get fucking transferred to a different school and get relentlessly bullied for a whole year, then proceed to go to high school where people all know each other because tight communities that you were never a part of, and as such you don‚Äôt get bullied no no no no. You get to be that kid that just isn‚Äôt worth as much as anyone else, you are the last pick in everything but also the first to get kicked out, you‚Äôre the type of kid that voices their opinion but you would be lucky to have it get laughed off never mind acknowledged.   Since all of that wasn‚Äôt enough to break a small 11 year olds psyche, life decided that the dickhead husband to my mother that I never bothered to get attached to left and we had to move house by ourselves while also looking after a 4 year old kid (my little sister). So after every day at school I came home to a depressed wailing mother and a blissfully unaware little sister. I spent 5 years worrying about everything from myself to exams that didn‚Äôt even matter to blah blah blah, I didn‚Äôt believe my life would get any better.  It hasn‚Äôt, being realistic it‚Äôs been more of the same. The pandemic was the best thing that has ever happened to me but i figure it‚Äôs just life telling me to enjoy what time I have left before I end it all. I‚Äôve wore a smile and pretended everything is ok for longer than I care to remember. But I‚Äôm starting to show tiny cracks to people without realising, I am inching closer to letting everything go despite me wanting to live oh so desperately. I won‚Äôt kill myself, not yet, I have a little sister I need to watch grow up and I haven‚Äôt failed everything, but the day I do is when I go back to the ground that all life came from. Until then I‚Äôll just keep breathing, because that‚Äôs just about all I feel I can do

Childhood Keeps Ruining Adulthood I hate being disabled. I'm pretty stupid, like, GENUINELY stupid. Special ed classes, easier work, "inclusion" programs that only isolated me more and more. If I weren't autistic, I wouldn't be interesting but I also wouldn't had to suffer through ableist schooling my entire life. I'd be normal and happy and smart instead of suicidal for... going on a decade, now?   I'm a high school senior in a specialized school. The reason I came here was to build up my art skills (I have a hella strong passion for animation) and be a child prodigy to prove everyone that I wasn't retarded; my old teachers who looked down on me and didn't even give me the support I needed in k-8, my parents who defended my teachers religiously, the classmates who bullied me ruthlessly, and most of all, myself. And I couldn't even do it.   My grades are low even when I had put in over 13 hours of work some days. Over 70% of the class of 2021 takes AP courses and has a lot of success coming their way, meanwhile I do algebra 2 with grade 10s and struggle my way to not being the rock-bottom member of that class. I'm terrified to even see my GPA. The general ed classes are almost lonely because so many kids are in AP. All my friends are in AP courses and haven't texted me about anything not school-related since the year began. And I don't measure up to my dream schools' standards because I'm a C+ student at best with no accomplishments except being a drama club member for 3 months (which I had to stop in order to get my grades up even though it made me happy.) Not a single one. All because I'm a dumb kid.   So I'm throwing in the towel. Not going to art school. It just... it simply can't be done. There's no point giving myself a several-month headache with the application process when I know for a fact I won't be accepted since I don't measure up. And even if it could, then it's all student loans and burnout and pain and too much responsibility for a 17-year-old to carry, anyways. I hate my life. I hate my present. My past is even worse. And now because of that, the future's pretty fucked up too. I don't know why I got my hopes up. Give me one reason to not take that 15 minute walk to the train station and die in the tracks. Or to just sit on the road and wait. Or to take a bunch of the ibuprofen I've got in my room.  The only reason I wanted to grow up was so I could escape school and maybe make a better time for myself. But now, suicide seems like my smartest option.

Rant‚Äî Nothing can fill the void that my parents left me. It sucks that the people who are supposed to support you, consistently project and invalidate any sign of emotion you have other than positivity.   I‚Äôve been diagnosed with major depressive disorder for three years now, even though I know I had it as long as I can remember. My mom acted like depression doesn‚Äôt exist, that it‚Äôs just how you look at things (and she couldn‚Äôt be more fucking wrong), as a kid every time I would cry or get upset she would berate me about my ‚Äúattitude‚Äù and I never even understood what fuck it meant. Not too long ago she said she felt ashamed that my father didn‚Äôt let me show any emotion whatsoever, when she literally does the same shit, in a more demeaning way. I have to pretend I don‚Äôt resent her for it, because I‚Äôm a worthless 20 almost 21 year old who can‚Äôt find a job and still can‚Äôt drive or even have credit cards bc no one even fucking bothered to teach me jack shit. So I still live at home. Stuck. I think it‚Äôs a control thing at this point, because oh, I‚Äôm just a wee little baby oh, I‚Äôm special needs, oh, I‚Äôm damaged goods, fuck off. I‚Äôm just not important enough. She thinks I‚Äôm not capable of anything. That‚Äôs not wrong though, lol. In her words I should have no say, that I need to be grateful. It‚Äôs a good thing to be grateful, but that doesn‚Äôt mean that I‚Äôm not allowed to feel the way that I do.   And don‚Äôt even get me started on my batshit father. I‚Äôm just going to say that he was physically abusive and a drug addict, I think that explains enough. And now my mom‚Äôs boyfriend, who I also live with, threatens to beat me as a joke, I guess. He says things like ‚Äújust beat her‚Äù to my mom when I‚Äôm agitated about something. Which is no laughing matter considering the shit I‚Äôve been through in my childhood. Now I‚Äôm like, okay, go ahead, beat me, give me another reason to off my fucking skull.  I guess my tldr is that I seriously feel so lost. I feel like I cannot amount to anything, I don‚Äôt know where the hell to start and nobody wants to help me. I want to leave. Trust me, I do. But I can‚Äôt where I‚Äôm at. It‚Äôs literally not fair, people my age are so successful and I feel nothing but resentment towards them, I don‚Äôt know how to do anything. I‚Äôm so fucking behind and overwhelmed because of that. I feel like suicide‚Äôs an option simply because I feel incapable of having a decent life, no amount of wine and trazodone will erase the deep rooted anger and sadness I feel in the big gaping hole where my heart used to be, long long ago. But I‚Äôm ungrateful, right?
